content:
TITLE: Checking if a User Signed Up (Passwordless/Social Login) in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Code example showing how to determine if a user is newly created when using passwordless consumeCode or social login signup APIs. The condition checks if the user created a new recipe user and has exactly one login method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// Here res refers to the result the function/api functions mentioned above.
const isNewUser = res.createdNewRecipeUser && res.user.loginMethods.length === 1;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Session-Based Account Linking for Magic Links in Passwordless Recipe
DESCRIPTION: Code snippet demonstrating how to override the consumeCode function in the Passwordless recipe to re-enable session-based account linking for magic link flows, which was disabled by default in version 0.14.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
Passwordless.init({
    override: {
        functions: (original) => {
            return {
                ...original,
                consumeCode: async (input) => {
                    // Please note that this is means that the session is required and will cause an error if it is not present
                    return original.consumeCode({ ...input, shouldTryLinkingWithSessionUser: true });
                },
            };
        },
    },
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking if a User Signed Up (EmailPassword) in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Code example demonstrating how to verify if a user is newly registered when using the EmailPassword sign up API. The condition checks if the user has exactly one login method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const isNewUser = res.user.loginMethods.length === 1;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Git Pre-commit Hooks for SuperTokens Web JS
DESCRIPTION: Command to configure Git pre-commit hooks which run automatically before each commit to ensure code quality standards are maintained.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run set-up-hooks
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the SuperTokens Web JS Project
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the project after code modifications. This compiles the source code and generates formatted output files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build-pretty
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Linter on SuperTokens Web JS
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the linter that checks for code style issues and potential errors. This should be executed before submitting any pull requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run lint
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies for SuperTokens Web JS
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all development dependencies for the SuperTokens web-js project. This step is required before making any code modifications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i -d
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running SuperTokens Vue Demo Application
DESCRIPTION: This command compiles and serves the Vue app while also starting the backend API server on port 3001. It launches the complete demo application for testing SuperTokens authentication features.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/examples/vuejs/with-thirdpartyemailpassword/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server which will run the demo app on localhost:3000.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/examples/react/with-thirdpartyemailpassword/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the SuperTokens SolidJS demo app
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the development server for the SuperTokens ThirdPartyEmailPassword demo app. After running this command, the app will be accessible at http://localhost:3000.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/examples/solidjs/with-thirdpartyemailpassword/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the SuperTokens Demo App
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server for the SuperTokens demo app. The application will be accessible at http://localhost:4321.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/examples/astro/with-thirdpartyemailpassword/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for SuperTokens Vue Demo
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary project dependencies using npm. It should be run in the project root directory before starting the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/examples/vuejs/with-thirdpartyemailpassword/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the project dependencies using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/examples/react/with-thirdpartyemailpassword/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing dependencies for SuperTokens SolidJS demo app
DESCRIPTION: This command uses npm to install the project dependencies required for the SuperTokens ThirdPartyEmailPassword demo app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/examples/solidjs/with-thirdpartyemailpassword/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies with npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all the required dependencies for the SuperTokens demo app using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-web-js/blob/master/examples/astro/with-thirdpartyemailpassword/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```
